activities.loc: Branch 2, Calumet County Courthouse, West Entrance

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert J. Trittin

Defendant requesting additional time to hire counsel, 
Court grants one more adjournment

346.63(1)(a) - OWI (5th or 6th)
346.63(1)(b) - Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th)

Shall maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or illegal drugs. 
Shall not possess any alcohol on person, in residence or occupied motor vehicle. 
Shall not possess or consume any controlled substance or paraphernalia, including syringes, without a valid prescription. 
The defendant must have installed a Transdermal Alcohol Monitoring system before release.  Shall comply with all rules established by the vendor.
Shall not remove or otherwise tamper with the Transdermal Alcohol Monitoring system without court approval.  The Transdermal Alcohol Monitoring system may only be removed by the vendor. 
Shall not leave state of Wisconsin without permission of the Court. 
Shall not apply for a passport while case is pending.

Defendant appears by video from Calumet County Jail,
Review of charges & penalties,
Court finds probable cause,
$5,000 Signature Bond ordered.
